subject: Self Care
title: Restless Mind Syndrome
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Restless Mind Syndrome.

hook.text: You sit to meditate and suddenly remember every errand, email, and unfinished task from the last decade.

buildup.text: This is normal. Sitting still reveals how chaotic the mind already is. You're not doing it wrong.

discovery.text: The restless mind was always there. You just weren't quiet enough to notice it running in the background.

twist.text: Trying to force the mind quiet makes it louder. Resistance amplifies the very thing you're resisting.

climax.text: Let thoughts pass like cars on a road. You don't have to chase every one. Just watch them go by.

punchline.text: A busy mind during meditation is the practice itself.

quiz.question: Is a restless mind during meditation a sign of failure?
options: No, noticing the restlessness is the actual practice
